Class SimpleRhomb

  • java.lang.Object
    • SimpleRhomb
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, Rhomb

    public class SimpleRhomb
extends java.lang.Object
implements Rhomb, java.io.Serializable
    A class representing a rhomb in a patch. The SimpleRhombs may shift about relative to one another.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • serialVersionUID

        public static final long serialVersionUID
        For serialization.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • p

        public Point p
        For plotting in the plane. A reference point indicating the position of the corner of the rhomb with even angles that has two outward-pointing arrows.

      • v1

        public final Point v1
        A vector indicating the first outward-pointing edge from p.

      • v2

        public final Point v2
        A vector indicating the second outward-pointing edge from p.

      • type

        public final int type
        The congruence class of rhomb.

      • angle

        public final int angle
        Orientation.

      • adjacent

        public final SimpleRhomb[] adjacent
        The rhombs that share edges in common with this one. This is at most four rhombs. If some edges are on the boundary, we indicate that by putting nulls there. The rhombs that share a v1-edge are listed at positions 0 and 3, the rhombs that share a v2-edge are at 1 and 2. The ones that share an edge of one and lie at the bases of the edges of the other type are listed at 0 and 1.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleRhomb

        public SimpleRhomb(Point p,
           Point v1,
           Point v2,
           int type,
           int angle)
        Public constructor.
        Parameters:
        p - A reference point indicating the corner of the rhomb with even angle and two outward-pointing arrows.
        v1 - A vector representation of the first outward-pointing edge from p.
        v2 - A vector representation of the second outward-pointing edge from p.
        type - A number indicating the congruence class of the rhomb.
        angle - An integer multiple of pi/Point.N() representing the angle the rhomb makes with the positive x-axis.

      • shift

        public void shift(Point vector)
        Shift the point by a given vector. This means that, when we draw the rhomb represented by this SimpleRhomb, it will be shifted.
        Specified by:
        shift in interface Rhomb
        Parameters:
        vector - The vector by which we shift point.

      • flip

        public static java.util.List<Hex> flip(SimpleRhomb[] triple,
                       boolean[] directions)
        Flip the positions of the given three rhombs. We assume, but do not check, that they form a hex. This method is called in SimpleHex.flip(). The rhombs aren't shifted here; we shift them in that method instead.
        Parameters:
        triple - The three rhombs that we flip.
        directions - For each rhomb in triple, do we shift it by the positive or the negative of the direction vector common to the two other rhombs?
        Returns:
        A list of SimpleHexes created or destroyed by this flip.

      • supertile

        public java.util.List<Point> supertile(Point[] infl,
                              int[] edge)
        Return a List of Points representing the inflation of this rhomb by the given factor, with edges distorted according to the given edge sequence.
        Parameters:
        infl - The inflation factor, represented as a matrix.
        edge - The edge sequence used to distort the edges.
        Returns:
        infl * this, with its edges distorted according to the rule specified by edge.

      • outline

        Parameters:
        infl - The inflation factor, represented as a matrix.
        edge - The edge sequence used to distort the edges.
        Returns:
        infl * this, with its edges distorted according to the rule specified by edge.
